name: Chocolate Chunk Cookies
steps: Chop chocolate into desired size and set aside. Save small shavings to sprinkle on before baking.
Cut butter into small cubes and melt in a small saucepan.
Whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.
Pour melted butter into a large mixing bowl and whisk in sugars. Add eggs one at a time to the butter mixture - whisking after each addition until just combined. Stir in vanilla extract.
Combine dry ingredients to wet mixture slowly and mix at low-medium speed. Once combined, add chopped chocolate to the dough.
Cover dough in parchment paper or plastic wrap and refrigerate for 15-30 minutes.
Once refrigerated, form dough into cookie balls using ice cream scoop and arrange on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with leftover choclate shavings.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until edges are golden brown.
Let cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes.
